page.title: 15PRESTON SHOPPING CENTRE
page.content: For the purposes of this survey we will look at the shops in the centre of Preston i.e. not including Fulwood, Plungington and other outlying districts. At the moment Preston centre is a mixture of streets and car-free shopping precincts. The planners are gradualy moving towards making Preston centre mainly pedestrian, and a new shopping centre is under construction near the railway station. Its area will be over 300,000 sq. feet and the cost will be Â£16m. It will include Asda and Debenhams stores. A recent survey showed that shoppers liked its modern facilities and its fairly wide selection of services. The main complaint was the problem of parking. In our class survey, 30 families had used the centre for shopping in the last week.
